story:
Once upon a time, in a beautiful Middle-Eastern village nestled at the foot of a majestic mountain, there lived a kind and curious little girl named Amira. Amira spent her days playing with her friends, helping her family with chores, and listening to the magical stories told by her grandmother.

One day, Amira's grandmother told her about the magical bird called the Simurgh that lived atop the mountain. The Simurgh, she said, was a wise and ancient creature that had seen the rise and fall of countless civilizations, and knew the secrets of the universe.

Amira was fascinated by the story of the Simurgh and begged her grandmother to take her to see the magical bird. Her grandmother warned her that the journey would be long and treacherous, and that the Simurgh was not easily found, but Amira was determined to see the bird for herself.

The next morning, Amira packed a small bag with food and water, said goodbye to her family, and set off on her journey. She climbed up the winding paths of the mountain, through lush forests and across rushing streams, all the while keeping her eyes and ears open for any sign of the Simurgh.

Days turned into weeks, and still, Amira had not found the Simurgh. She began to tire and wondered if she would ever find the magical bird. Just as she was about to give up, she heard a faint whispering sound, like the rustling of leaves. She followed the sound until she came to a clearing, and there, perched on a branch of a towering tree, was the Simurgh.

The Simurgh was more beautiful than Amira could have ever imagined. Its feathers shimmered in the sunlight, and its eyes twinkled with ancient wisdom. Amira approached the bird slowly, not wanting to startle it, and when she was close enough, she asked the Simurgh to share its wisdom with her.

The Simurgh looked down at Amira and spoke in a gentle, melodic voice. "The secrets of the universe are not for the taking," it said. "They must be earned through patience, kindness, and understanding."

Amira looked up at the Simurgh in wonder and asked, "But how can I earn such wisdom?"

The Simurgh smiled and said, "By living a life full of love, curiosity, and compassion, you will find that wisdom will come to you in time. And always remember, the greatest wisdom is in the heart, not the mind."

Amira thanked the Simurgh for its wise words, and with a newfound sense of purpose, she returned to her village. She spent the rest of her days living a life full of love, kindness, and curiosity, and as she grew older, she found that wisdom did indeed come to her as the Simurgh had promised. And she never forgot the greatest wisdom of all, that it resided in her heart.

And so, Amira lived a long and fulfilling life, always grateful for the day she met the magical Simurgh on the mountain. And every night, before she went to bed, she would look up at the stars and thank the Simurgh for sharing its wisdom with her.

Now, my dear child, it's time for you to close your eyes and dream of magical birds and great wisdom. Good night.
